GapFillInput.Instruction: Listen to the video of people talking about times in different countries and click on the correct answer.

Content.Question:
Lisa: Okay, are you ready? How many minutes are there in a year? Are there:
a) about 87,000|87000
b) about 525,000
c) about 2,000,000|2000000?
Rob: Minutes in a year … so 60 minutes in an hour, 24 hours in a day, that’s 1,440|1440 and 365 days in a year … that’s … about … er … 500,000. So that’s b) 525,000.
Lisa: Correct!
Jane: Okay, it’s your turn. How long is the River Amazon? Is it
a) about 500 kilometres
b) 6,000 kilometres or
c) 10,000 kilometres?
Nick: I’ve got no idea! It’s very long. What do you think, Lisa? Okay, let’s say c) 10,000 kilometres.
Jane: Wrong!!! It’s b), about 6,000|6000 kilometres. Ha ha!!
Nick: Right. Ah! Good one! How fast can an elephant run? Can it run at
a) 5 kilometres per hour
b) 20 kilometres per hour or
c) 50 kilometres per hour?
Jane: Hmm … Not 50 kilometres an hour, but I think an elephant can run quite fast. Faster than a person. I saw a film on television once …
Rob: No, I think 5 kilometres – a).
Nick: Is that your final answer?
Jane: No, I’m sure it’s 20 kilometres.
Rob: I don’t think so but okay, if you’re sure. Okay, then, b).
Nick: And the answer is … b), an elephant can run at 20 kilometres per hour.
Jane: Yeah! I was right! See!!
